name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー
aliases: The Right Hand of the Pirate King

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Reveals His Identity as Roger's First Mate
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh reveals to the Straw Hats that he served as the vice-captain and first mate of Gol D. Roger's crew.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Rayleigh's legendary status and connection to the Pirate King, making him one of the most important living figures in One Piece history.
keyMoments.quote: I was the vice-captain and first mate of the Roger Pirates.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Truth About Roger's Surrender
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh reveals that Roger was never captured but voluntarily turned himself in after disbanding his crew.
keyMoments.significance: Rewrites the official history and reveals Roger's intentional plan to spark the Great Pirate Era.
keyMoments.quote: Roger was never captured. He turned himself in.

keyMoments.title: Confirms Knowledge of the Void Century
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh confirms that the Roger Pirates learned everything about the Void Century, Ancient Weapons, and the Will of D.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes that someone alive knows the complete truth about the world's greatest mysteries.
keyMoments.quote: Yes, we know. We learned everything.

keyMoments.title: Offers to Coat the Thousand Sunny
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh offers to coat the Straw Hats' ship for free and provides them with Vivre Cards.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Rayleigh as a mentor and benefactor to the Straw Hats, setting up their eventual training relationship.

relationships.description: Served as Gol D. Roger's first mate and right-hand man throughout his journey to become Pirate King.

evolutionMoments.description: Rayleigh reveals his role as Roger's first mate and shares stories of their adventures.

relationships.description: Rayleigh sees Roger's spirit in Luffy and offers to help the Straw Hats by coating their ship.

evolutionMoments.description: Rayleigh offers to coat the Sunny for free and provides Vivre Cards, beginning his role as a mentor to the crew.

reveals.information: Was the first mate of the Roger Pirates
Knows the complete truth about the Void Century, Ancient Weapons, and the Will of D

keyMoments.title: Roger's Illness and Voluntary Surrender Revealed
keyMoments.description: It is revealed that Roger contracted an incurable disease four years before his execution and chose to turn himself in voluntarily.
keyMoments.significance: Fundamentally changes the understanding of Roger's final days and shows his intentional plan to spark the Great Pirate Era.

keyMoments.title: Roger's Ability to Hear the Voice of All Things
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh reveals that Roger possessed the ability to 'hear the voice of all things,' allowing him to understand Poneglyphs without reading them.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals a mysterious power that Roger possessed, connecting it to similar abilities shown by Luffy.

statusHistory.cause: Executed by the World Government in Loguetown

abilities.description: The ability to hear the voice of all things, allowing Roger to understand Poneglyphs and communicate with certain entities without conventional reading or speaking.

relationships.description: Rayleigh served as Roger's first mate and closest companion throughout his journey as Pirate King.

evolutionMoments.description: Rayleigh reveals his role as Roger's first mate and shares their history together.

relationships.description: Crocus joined Roger's crew as the ship's doctor to help manage Roger's incurable disease during his final voyage.

evolutionMoments.description: Revealed that Crocus joined the Roger Pirates to help manage Roger's illness.

reveals.information: Possessed the ability to hear the voice of all things
Contracted an incurable disease four years before his execution
Voluntarily turned himself in to the Marines rather than being captured

keyMoments.title: Robin Asks About the Void Century
keyMoments.description: Robin asks Rayleigh about the Void Century, revealing the Roger inscription she found on the Skypiea Poneglyph.
keyMoments.significance: Directly addresses the central mystery of the series and confirms that someone alive knows the complete truth.

keyMoments.title: Robin Refuses to Learn the Truth from Rayleigh
keyMoments.description: Robin politely declines Rayleigh's offer to tell her everything about the Void Century, choosing to discover it herself.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Robin's character growth and her commitment to finding the truth through her own journey with the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.quote: No, thank you. I want to learn the truth with my own eyes, through my journey with my friends.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Threatens to Quit if Anyone Asks About One Piece
keyMoments.description: Luffy forcefully stops Usopp from asking about One Piece's location, declaring he'll quit being a pirate if anyone reveals such information.
keyMoments.significance: Defines Luffy's philosophy that the journey and adventure matter more than shortcuts to the goal, paralleling Roger's spirit.
keyMoments.quote: I don't want to know where the treasure is! If you tell me anything, I'll quit being a pirate!

keyMoments.title: Kizaru's Dramatic Arrival at Sabaody
keyMoments.description: Admiral Kizaru arrives at Sabaody Archipelago by riding atop a cannonball, creating a frightening explosion.
keyMoments.significance: Signals the Marines' response to the Celestial Dragon incident and escalates the threat for all pirates on the island.

keyMoments.title: Brook's Unique Historical Perspective
keyMoments.description: Brook casually refers to Gol D. Roger as a 'rookie,' demonstrating he lived before Roger became the Pirate King.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights Brook's unique position as someone who lived through multiple eras of piracy and provides perspective on legendary figures.
keyMoments.quote: Oh yes, I remember hearing about a rookie named Roger back in my day.

keyMoments.title: Crocus Joins Roger's Final Journey
keyMoments.description: It is revealed that Crocus joined the Roger Pirates as ship's doctor to help manage Roger's incurable disease during his final voyage.
keyMoments.significance: Explains Crocus's connection to the Pirate King and why he was at Twin Capes when the Straw Hats met him.

relationships.description: Crocus served as the ship's doctor for the Roger Pirates during Roger's final journey.

evolutionMoments.description: Revealed that Crocus joined Roger's crew to help manage his terminal illness.

reveals.information: Was a member of the Roger Pirates as their ship's doctor
